info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 4:22PM EDT until July 13 at 2:32AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Connecticut River Below Holyoke affecting Hampden County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Connecticut...Massachusetts... Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Hartford and Middlesex Counties. Connecticut River At Thompsonville affecting Hartford and Hampden Counties. Connecticut River ABOVE Holyoke Dam affecting Hampden County. Connecticut River At Northampton affecting Hampden and Hampshire Counties. Connecticut River At Montague affecting Franklin and Hampshire Counties. Connecticut River At Middle Haddam affecting Middlesex County. Farmington River At Simsbury affecting Hartford County. For the Connecticut River...including Holyoke, Middle Haddam, Montague, Holyoke Dam, Northampton, Hartford, Thompsonville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River at Montague. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 31.0 feet, Flooding of low lying areas outside of levee protection is likely from Greenfield through Hatfield. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 32.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 28.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:30 PM EDT Tuesday was 32.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue falling to 22.0 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 32.1 feet on 04/23/1958. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 630 AM EDT.
